text: Examples of faith can be found throughout the scriptures.
explanation: Scripture stories illustrate the power of faith in action.

summary: This lesson explores the concept of faith, its definition, and scriptural examples.
story: Mary Fielding Smith demonstrated incredible faith during her journey across the plains, trusting that God would provide for her and her family despite significant obstacles.
quotes: Faith is not to have a perfect knowledge of things; therefore if ye have faith ye hope for things which are not seen, which are true. — Alma 32:21
questions: How can we cultivate greater faith in our daily lives?
What scriptural examples of faith resonate most deeply with you?

questions.title: Faith Through Trials

subpoints.text: Trials often serve as catalysts for spiritual growth.
subpoints.explanation: Facing adversity with faith can refine and strengthen our testimony.

questions.summary: Trials faced with faith can deepen our trust and reliance on the Lord.
questions.story: Joseph Smith's experiences in Liberty Jail demonstrated how faith can sustain and comfort us through trials, ultimately drawing us closer to God.
quotes: The Lord compensates the faithful for every loss. — Joseph B. Wirthlin
questions: What trials have strengthened your faith the most?
How can we use trials as opportunities for spiritual growth?
